    pass

    def baz():
        pass

def bar(): pass

# Literally included file using Python highlighting
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

foo = "Including Unicode characters: √º√∂√§"

class Foo:
    pass

class Bar:
    def baz():
        pass

def bar(): pass
END CODE

foo = "Including Unicode characters: √º√∂√§"

class Foo:
    pass

class Bar:
    def baz():
        pass

def bar(): pass

# Literally included file using Python highlighting
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

foo = "Including Unicode characters: √º√∂√§"

--- literal_orig.inc
+++ literal.inc
@@ -1,12 +1,12 @@
 # Literally included file using Python highlighting
 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
 
-foo = "Including Unicode characters: √º√∂√§"  # This will be changed
+foo = "Including Unicode characters: √º√∂√§"
 
-class FooOrig:
+class Foo:
     pass
 
-class BarOrig:
+class Bar:
     def baz():
         pass

8. Docutils include with “literal”¬∂

While not recommended, it should work (and leave quotes alone).

Testing "quotes" in literal 'included' text.
